content.title: Sant Surdas Scheme
content.beneficiary: Persons with Disabilities aged between 0 and 17 years
content.details: The scheme 'Sant Surdas Scheme' was launched by the Director Social Defence, Department of Social Justice & Empowerment, Government of Gujarat. Under the scheme, monthly financial assistance is provided to Persons with Disabilities aged between 0 and 17 years, who have a disability of more than 80% and are registered in the Below Poverty Line (BPL) list.
benefits: Under the scheme, a monthly assistance of ₹1,000/- is paid to the beneficiary by the State Government through DBT.
eligibility: The applicant should be a native of Gujarat.
The applicant should be 0 to 17 years age group.
Percentage of disability of 80 or more or those who cannot move even with help of artificial limbs independently.
The applicant should be registered in the Below Poverty Line (BPL) list and BPL score is up to 20.
The benefit of this scheme is eligible to the disabled person of Gujarat living under the Below Poverty Line.
The applicant should be possessing disability card issued by state government.
documents_required: Caste Certificate issued by competent authority, if applicable
Disability Identity Card/Disability Certificate from a Civil Surgeon
Proof of Age (School Leaving Certificate/Birth certificate)
Certificate to the effect that his name is included BPL list with score up to 20
Proof of Residence (Any one of Ration Card/Electricity Bill/Driving License/Aadhaar Card/Election Card)
First Page Copy of Bank Passbook/Cancelled Cheque

faqs.question: What is the Sant Surdas Scheme?
faqs.answer: The 'Sant Surdas Scheme' is a government initiative launched by the Director Social Defence, Department of Social Justice & Empowerment, Government of Gujarat, aimed at providing financial assistance to Persons with Disabilities.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the Scheme?
faqs.answer: Individuals who are natives of Gujarat, aged between 0 and 17 years, with a disability of 80% or more, and registered in the Below Poverty Line (BPL) list are eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the financial assistance provided under the Scheme?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries receive a monthly assistance of ₹1,000/- from the State Government through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).

faqs.question: Is there a cutoff age for receiving assistance under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, financial assistance ceases when the beneficiary reaches the age of 18 years.

faqs.question: How to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible applicants can apply through the e-Samaj Kalyan Portal: https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in/
